title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:52 <tekzilla> has quit  
00:56 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki

01:14 <Enygma`1> has quit  
01:15 <Enygma`> has quit  
01:24 <vmassol> has quit  
02:46 <qwebirc88976> has joined #xwiki  
02:47 <qwebirc88976> has quit  
06:00 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:14 <sburjan`> has quit  
06:15 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <CIA-32> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* ra39a491 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/uploadfailure.vm : [misc] Explain a magic value - http://git.io/njlHTQ  
07:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <vmassol> has quit  
08:46 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:06 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <qwebirc8228> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <qwebirc8228> hi guys, does the mail plugin support NTLM authentication?  
09:29 <qwebirc8228> I'm cannot go through the authentication...  
09:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r49a1bd4 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/wysiwyg/MacroTest.java : XE-949: WYSIWYG MacroTest#testHoldDeleteKeyBeforeMacro() fails erroniously on CI server. - http://git.io/8yJa1A  
09:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <sburjan`> has quit  
10:24 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <vmassol> good morning  
10:30 <vmassol> sdumitriu/mflorea: one thing we should add in the release process is to update the roadmap page on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap I think  
10:30 <vmassol> especially now that we're using the jira macro  
10:30 <@sdumitriu> Yep, saw it yesterday  
10:30 <vmassol> because if we don't remove the not done jira issues  
10:31 <vmassol> then when they get done they'll appear in the roadmap for already released versions  
10:31 <vmassol> so what I did for the previous release was to only keep the jiras that were done but it's a pity ebcause we can't see what we had planned either  
10:32 <vmassol> so we need a better solution  
10:32 <vmassol> any idea?  
10:32 <vmassol> maybe a date param for the jira macro  
10:32 <vmassol> to perform some additional filtering  
10:33 <vmassol> fixfor is better actually  
10:33 <vmassol> that should work  
10:33 <vmassol> so the fixfor param would be used only if we don't pass any jql and pass a discrete list of jiras  
10:34 <vmassol> in this case the fixfor would be applied in the generated JQL  
10:34 <vmassol> wdyt?  
10:34 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <vmassol1> we don't want just to filter them out  
10:34 <vmassol1> we still need to display them  
10:35 <vmassol1> maybe an additional column simply  
10:35 <vmassol1> that says when the issue was fixed (ie a fixfor column)  
10:35 <vmassol1> at least that's doable right now and already provides some info  
10:35 <vmassol1> I'll do that for now  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:36 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I don't understand how this solves the problem... Or maybe I don't understand the problem?  
10:36 <@sdumitriu> Oh, I see  
10:37 <kayasaman> has quit  
10:37 <@sdumitriu> I wonder if --{{jira...}}-- would work as a strikethrough...  
10:37 <vmassol1> we don't want to do N requests  
10:37 <vmassol1> we need a single request  
10:38 <vmassol1> for perf reasons  
10:38 <vmassol1> re the status  
10:38 <vmassol> has quit  
10:38 <vmassol1> using strikethrough or the status icon doesn't change the issue  
10:38 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
10:39 <kayasaman> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <vmassol> hmm it seems we cannot use the URL for getting the fix versions. I need to dig more  
11:07 <vmassol> (and there can be several fix versions)  
11:07 <vmassol> ah works with fixVersions (with an s)  
11:08 <vmassol> but the jira macro needs to be modified  
11:08 <vmassol> FTR: http://jira.xwiki.org/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=issueKey=XWIKI-1000+OR+issueKey=XWIKI-4356+OR+issueKey=XWIKI-3677&field=fixVersions  
11:22 <+mflorea> vmassol: I have an issue with a selenium 2 test. I'm sending the Keys.TAB key to an input. On FF9.01 the focus is moved to the next input and the test passes. On FF3.6 the TAB key is sent but it fails to focus the next input because of http://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=368 . The second comment is important. If I enabled native events the test passes on FF3.6 also. I'm tempted to leave the test as it is, but it will generate false negatives.   
11:23 <vmassol> so if you enable native events, what happens for people on mac?  
11:24 <+sburjan> hello vmassol . When would be available for a short call on how we could improve the jira macro by adding the capability to access private jiras. I have an idea but I want to discuss it with you  
11:24 <+mflorea> I don't know :( . They don't state why native events are disabled by default for linux and mac  
11:24 <vmassol> linux too? thought it was only mac  
11:24 <+mflorea> just a sec  
11:24 <vmassol> The immediate solution would be to run the tests from a platform that supports native  
11:24 <vmassol> events - Windows or Linux (it has to be explicitly enabled for Linux, though, by  
11:24 <vmassol> calling FirefoxProfile.setEnableNativeEvents(true)).  
11:25 <+mflorea> // For now, only enable native events on Windows  
11:25 <+mflorea>   public static final boolean DEFAULT\_ENABLE\_NATIVE\_EVENTS = Platform.getCurrent().is(WINDOWS);  
11:25 <+mflorea> from FirefoxDriver  
11:25 <vmassol> by default mflorea I think  
11:25 <vmassol> but you can enable them  
11:25 <vmassol> FirefoxProfile.setEnableNativeEvents  
11:25 <+mflorea> yes, but I don't know the consequences  
11:26 <vmassol> ideally it would be just ignored on platforms that don't support them  
11:26 <+mflorea> if they are supported, why aren't they enabled by default  
11:26 <vmassol> yeah  
11:26 <vmassol> good question  
11:26 <vmassol> ok different track  
11:26 <vmassol> why do we need tab?  
11:26 <+mflorea> there must be a reason why they are disabled by default on linux and mac  
11:26 <vmassol> can't we write the test differently?  
11:27 <vmassol> (mflorea: I think the reason is that it wasn't considered working well enough yet)  
11:27 <vmassol> (but I think they've been enabled recently on some platform - need to check RN)  
11:28 <vmassol> (I'm probably confusing with "\* Native events enabled for Firefox 9")  
11:28 <+mflorea> not really. I have an input that filters typed characters, i.e. it accepts only digits (0-9) and special keys like Left/Right arrow and Tab. At some point the Tab key was not included in the list of accepted keys, and you couldn't move the focus to then next input. This test verifies that you can navigate with Tab  
11:28 <vmassol> anyway the best bet IMO  
11:28 <vmassol> it to wrtie the test differnetly  
11:29 <vmassol> let's not write a test for TAB FTM then  
11:29 <vmassol> we can add a comment with a link to this issue with a todo when the issue is fixed  
11:29 <+mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4230  
11:29 <vmassol> this means that this is a test that sburjan will have to do manually for now :)  
11:29 <+mflorea> but the test passes on FF9 :(  
11:29 <vmassol> or we just run this test on some platform  
11:29 <vmassol> and some FF version  
11:29 <+mflorea> yes, that would be best  
11:30 <vmassol> that might be useful to add to our framework  
11:30 <+mflorea> but how do we specify that a rest should be run only in a specific browser  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:31 <vmassol> s/rest/test?  
11:31 <+mflorea> yes  
11:31 <+mflorea> :)  
11:31 <+mflorea> let me check something  
11:32 <vmassol> there's probably an api in selenium to get the platform  
11:32 <+sburjan> vmassol: note that we'll have to make tests work on Windows too, with different browsers. We'll have to discuss if we can make a test work on multiple browsers .. I have to investigate how much do we need to change in current tests  
11:32 <vmassol> sburjan: re the call I'm a bit busy now but we could schedule something this afternoon  
11:32 <vmassol> I'd also like to discuss the move of the jira macro as a java macro in platform  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <vmassol> quick poll guys: wdyt about moving the jira macro as a java macro in platform?  
11:33 <+sburjan> okay. afternoon it is. I'll be available when you want  
11:34 <+mflorea> +1 but we should call it jira, not jira2 :)  
11:34 <vmassol> ofc  
11:34 <+sburjan> ofc  
11:34 <vmassol> btw mflorea http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/NativeEventsOnLinux  
11:36 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:37 <vmassol> maybe we can use DesiredCapabilities  
11:37 <vmassol> yep looks cool  
11:37 <vmassol> http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/remote/DesiredCapabilities.html  
11:38 <vmassol> don't know how well or it works but maybe something to explore  
11:38 <vmassol> unless webdriver already has some annotation to run a test only for a given paltform  
11:38 <vmassol> that might not be impossible  
11:38 <kayasaman> has quit  
11:39 <+tmortagne> vmassol: +1 for jira macro in java  
11:40 <vmassol> ok I'll send a proper vote on the list  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> +1 for java macro  
11:41 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:41 <vmassol> vote sent  
11:43 <+sburjan> jira Macro in java ? :)  
11:43 <+sburjan> who is going to port it ?  
11:50 <kayasaman> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki

13:49 <+sburjan> guys, I am on a 3.4 final at /xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/DefaultSkin .. but I don't have any text area beneath the Logo. Is this normal ?  
13:50 <+sburjan> when I edit it  
14:02 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:04 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* r1939066 / (5 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-7421: Add new Index Module ...  
14:42 <+sburjan> someone ?  
14:45 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* rfa7a5fd / (2 files in 2 dirs): [Misc] Align package names - http://git.io/Cl5lcQ  
14:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw creating a job automatically in jenkins doesn't seem that hard: http://ci.xwiki.org/api/  
14:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: even better: http://evgeny-goldin.com/wiki/Maven-jenkins-plugin :)  
14:52 <+tmortagne> indeed it seems easy but why maven plugin ?  
14:52 <vmassol> to generate one maven job per pom.xml easily  
14:52 <vmassol> it'll generate the config.xml file  
14:52 <vmassol> makes it even simpler to create all platform jobs  
14:52 <vmassol> you go at the top level of platform and run the mojo  
14:52 <vmassol> and all your jobs are created  
14:53 <vmassol> for the current branch  
14:53 <vmassol> :)  
14:53 <+tmortagne> ok  
14:53 <vmassol> (haven't tried it, this is the theory)  
14:54 <vmassol> btw this also allows to put our jenkins conf in SCM which is nice  
14:55 <+tmortagne> yep  
14:56 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <qwebirc8228> has quit  
15:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: you've put back parallel execution on platform for jenkins  
15:32 <vmassol> however we have a potential issue right now  
15:32 <vmassol> since we have 2 modules containing functional tests  
15:32 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I asked you before putting it back  
15:32 <vmassol> (I don't know if this is what caused the last failure)  
15:33 <vmassol> can I remove it?  
15:33 <+tmortagne> if they don't depends from each other they could be executed at the same time yes  
15:33 <vmassol> hmm  
15:33 <vmassol> they do depend on each other  
15:34 <+tmortagne> then maven should not execute then at the same time  
15:34 <vmassol> I have a hard time reading the console log  
15:34 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1421/console  
15:34 <+tmortagne> but we could have the issue anyway since you are about add more modules  
15:34 <vmassol> well we need to decide if we run them in platform or not  
15:35 <vmassol> we could decide to run them just in XE  
15:35 <vmassol> both have some issues  
15:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: reading http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1421/console they seem to be executed at the same time  
15:36 <+tmortagne> looks like it's failing when executing xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin and this should not have any issue with paralel execution  
15:36 <vmassol> "Building XWiki Platform - Index - Tests - Functional Tests 3.5-SNAPSHOT" starts  
15:36 <vmassol> then before it's finished  
15:36 <vmassol> you have "Building XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests 3.5-SNAPSHOT"  
15:36 <vmassol> note: the console really is a mess and unreadable with // runs  
15:37 <+tmortagne> there is only two thread, you can't have two test running and also the packager plugin  
15:37 <vmassol> packager plugin is running twice at the same time  
15:37 <+tmortagne> also "XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests  SKIPPED" means it did not even tried to build it  
15:37 <vmassol> that's not true see above  
15:38 <+tmortagne> as I said I don't see why parallel execution would be an issue with packager plugin  
15:38 <+tmortagne> it's not starting some server on a unique port or something like that  
15:38 <vmassol> packager and tests run in the same module  
15:39 <vmassol> I see what you mean  
15:39 <vmassol> I don't know why it failed here  
15:39 <+tmortagne> I can assure you that "SKIPPED" means that maven is not supposed to have tried to build it because a build before it failed  
15:39 <vmassol> both built for sure  
15:39 <vmassol> it's written  
15:39 <vmassol> just look at the console  
15:39 <vmassol> you can search for what I mentioned  
15:39 <vmassol> I'll repeat:  
15:39 <vmassol> "Building XWiki Platform - Index - Tests - Functional Tests 3.5-SNAPSHOT"  
15:40 <vmassol> "Building XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests 3.5-SNAPSHOT"  
15:40 <vmassol> you'll see they both start to build  
15:40 <+tmortagne> I don't see why maven say it did not executed it  
15:40 <vmassol> no idea about that  
15:41 <vmassol> well maven does say some strange things at the end:  
15:41 <vmassol> but it's on other moduels:  
15:41 <vmassol> Skipping XWiki Platform - Tag - Parent POM  
15:41 <vmassol> [INFO] This project has been banned from the build due to previous failures.  
15:41 <vmassol> where do you see the skipped?  
15:42 <vmassol> this: [INFO] XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests  SKIPPED  
15:42 <vmassol>  ?  
15:42 <vmassol> I think it's because  
15:42 <vmassol> it didn't have the time to finish  
15:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: teh Building XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests 3.5-SNAPSHOT you see is the clean  
15:42 <+tmortagne> not the install I think  
15:42 <vmassol> the other one failed before it could finish  
15:42 <vmassol> I think  
15:42 <vmassol> other one being: [INFO] XWiki Platform - LinkChecker - Tests - Functional Tests  SKIPPED  
15:43 <vmassol> but then maybe not I don't know how it works in //  
15:43 <+tmortagne> hmm no there is not only clean it seems  
15:44 <+tmortagne> maven Summary seems buggy with T option  
15:44 <vmassol> anyway can I remove the -T for now  
15:44 <vmassol> ?  
15:44 <+tmortagne> as you want  
15:44 <vmassol> to verify the build works fine first  
15:44 <+tmortagne> well the build used to work fine  
15:44 <vmassol> I've done some commits  
15:45 <vmassol> done, I've triggered a rebuild  
15:45 <+tmortagne> the summary is definitely bad, I can see a SKIPPED before the first FAILURE  
15:46 <+mflorea> vmassol: found a new test issue. They fixed http://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=2320 which you reported, but only for recent version of FF. For FF3.6 we have http://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=2628 . Because of this 2 import tests are failing because the delete attachment link is clicked twice. I'll add a check for FF3.6 if you're not against it :)  
15:59 <vmassol> ok for me  
16:00 <+mflorea> ok  
16:07 <+sburjan> vmassol: In 1h I won't be available anymore, do you want to postpone the meeting for tomorrow ?  
16:07 <vmassol> sburjan: yes that's better for me if you don't miind since today I'm in Paris and I don't have a quiet place to speak  
16:08 <+sburjan> okay. We'll have a meeting tomorrow. Don't forget I will be in Paris one week :)

17:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:03 <tmortagne> mflorea: do you know if http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/935/testReport/ are flickering tests ?  
17:03 <tmortagne> age 1  
17:04 <mflorea> tmortagne: all will be fixed by next commit, hopefully  
17:04 <tmortagne> ok  
17:06 <sdumitriu> is now known as <Guest66115>  
17:13 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
17:31 <sburjan> has quit  
17:38 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5b55b15 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/ClassEditSheet.xml : XWIKI-7441: Class field preview and Save&Continue don't work in Firefox 3.6 ...  
17:38 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rd91f67c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-test/src/main/java/org/xwiki/test/ui/TestUtils.java : [misc] Add APIs to build attachment URLs. - http://git.io/d25GBw  
17:40 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5c8fc6d / (2 files in 2 dirs): Add checks for Firefox 3.6 because Selenium has some issues with this version. - http://git.io/gHGS4w  
17:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: what user agent naming did you use for linkchecker ?  
17:48 <vmassol> checking  
17:54 <vmassol>         // Set our user agent to be a good citizen.  
17:54 <vmassol>         this.httpClient.getParams().setParameter(HttpMethodParams.USER\_AGENT, "XWikiLinkChecker");  
17:54 <vmassol> (tmortagne)  
17:54 <tmortagne> ok thanks  
17:54 <vmassol> note that you shouldn't have white spaces  
17:55 <tmortagne> or looking at the specs  
17:55 <tmortagne> hmm there is white spaces in the user browser user agent it seems  
17:56 <tmortagne> http://whatsmyuseragent.com/  
17:56 <vmassol> yes sure  
17:56 <vmassol> but that's another meaning  
17:56 <vmassol> you can read the RFC  
17:56 <vmassol> (that's what I did)  
17:56 <tmortagne> yep that's what I was about to d  
17:56 <tmortagne> do  
17:56 <tmortagne> what about putting the the /version ?  
17:56 <vmassol> initially I wrongly put white spaces and fixed it after  
17:57 <vmassol> I hesiatetd for the version but I don't recall why I decided not to put one  
17:57 <tmortagne> maybe because right now there is no official way to know the platform version ;)  
17:57 <vmassol> ah  
17:58 <vmassol> here's the comment I put when I committed  
17:58 <vmassol> "deally we would use "XWikiLinkChecker/" but we don't have access to the XE version from the linkchecker transformation..."  
17:58 <vmassol> \*Ideally  
17:58 <tmortagne> we should not use XE version  
17:58 <vmassol> bad paste  
17:58 <vmassol> "Ideally we would use "XWikiLinkChecker/(version of XE)" but we don't have access to the XE version from the linkchecker transformation..."  
17:58 <tmortagne> but not sure where to put the platform version, there is no real central component, or we put the version on all modules  
17:59 <vmassol> I decided not to solve this now when I committed ;)
